author: {'steamid': '76561198038388312', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1706913184}

author: {'steamid': '76561198955095286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6778, 'last_played': 1706441017}
review: Este juego es una joya para aquellos a los que nos gusta historia, mitología y los juegos de estrategia y gestión. Lo jugué de pequeña y al verlo aquí no pude evitar comprarlo, cosa de la que no me arrepiento. A pesar de ser un título con unos años encima, la temática y la jugabilidad es genial (no demasiado complicada per ocon suficientes variaciones para no aburrirse) .Los gráficos no son de última generación, pero es lo esperado a la época.  Lo mejor del juego es cómo te sumerge en el desafío de dirigir diversas ciudades a traves de diversas historias, gestionar recursos y lidiar con dioses y héroes es el pan de cada día. Es un título que invita a horas de planificación y estrategia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357533096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1706403137}
review: best game since i was a child

author: {'steamid': '76561198896868238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4534, 'last_played': 1710529040}
review: I have distinct memories of playing this game before I even knew how to read, and being really angry all the time at how hard it was. Still, I loved sinking hours into the sandbox map and building as many temples as I could. Now that I'm actually literate and know how to play strategy games, this still holds up amazingly and I find myself actually chipping away at the quests with a sense of understanding. Hands down one of the best games I'd say ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561199033097026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4455, 'last_played': 1707840400}

author: {'steamid': '76561199557400863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1711562587}
review:
Kupiłem grę z sentymentu, odpaliłem z myślą, że posiedzę chwilę i rzucę w kąt.

Ale chwila zamieniła się w 4 godziny, a myśli są ulotne i teraz wiem, że godzin będzie o wiele więcej. 
Momentalnie cofnąłem się o jakieś 15-18 lat, kiedy namiętnie w nią grałem. Mimo, że rozgrywka nie jest bardzo rozbudowana, a po grafice widać, że gra ma prawie 24 lata to nadal wciąga i cieszy mordę.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129144847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1702512713}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044313157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1705966293}
review:
Zeus: Maestro del Olimpo es un juego que no solo te transporta a la grandeza de la antigua Grecia, sino que también despierta recuerdos de tu niñez, cuando los videojuegos eran una puerta a mundos mágicos y emocionantes.

Zeus no solo te brinda una experiencia de juego profunda y estratégica, sino que también te hace sentir como un arquitecto divino, creando ciudades y forjando imperios. Cada decisión que tomas es como un paso hacia la construcción de tu propia leyenda, y cada desafío es una oportunidad para demostrar tu astucia y habilidades.

A pesar de que los gráficos pueden no estar a la vanguardia de la tecnología actual, la jugabilidad y la inmersión son atemporales. Es un recordatorio de que la calidad de un juego no se mide por su apariencia, sino por la profundidad de la experiencia que ofrece.

Zeus es una mezcla única de economía y mitología, donde tus acciones tienen un impacto tanto en el crecimiento de tu ciudad como en tu relación con los dioses y las criaturas míticas. Cada partida es una oportunidad para tejer nuevas historias y revivir esos momentos mágicos de tu infancia cuando los videojuegos venían con CDs y manuales ilustrados.

Zeus: Maestro del Olimpo es un viaje épico que te lleva a la grandeza de la antigua Grecia y te permite revivir la emoción de tu niñez en el mundo de los videojuegos. Es una experiencia que trasciende el tiempo y el espacio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034375297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1701887152}
review: Nostalgie pur. Schöne Erinnerung an meine Kindheit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198424614946', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1609694154}
review:
I used to play this game a lot. I still remember I got the first sight of the game for a demo cd. played so many times and thought the demo version was the full game. Then found nooooo, theres more! so much more to zeus. And then once i completed twice, i found out there was posiedon! And then i found out that there was an online small community who build campaigns in same league of an age of empires! and those campaigns can be loaded into the game for free and legally!
i bought it so that i can retain this game forever...

author: {'steamid': '76561198023434508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 5052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5052, 'last_played': 1700415296}
review:
Zeus est le 3ème opus de la série de city builder d'Impression Games. C'est un jeu old school mais avec beaucoup de charme comme ses semblables. Je le dis cependant à ceux qui connaissent la série ou qui voudrait la découvrir : c'est celui que j'ai le moins apprécié et de loin.

+ Combine les idées des jeux précédents (Pharaoh et Caesar III) et y ajoute un nouveau système de dieux incarnés, de monstres mythiques et de héros (+ d'autres idées sympa côté city building et diplomatie)
+ Culture grec et mythologie pour ceux qui aiment (bien que sous-exploité en réalité)
+ Besoins des habitants simplifiés, facile de faire de quartiers très optimisés

- Les nouveaux systèmes sont très brouillons et parfois frustrants. On sent qu'Impression Games a pas mal dû améliorer cette recette avant de sortir le dernier (et meilleur) opus (Emperor Rise of the Middle Kingdom)
- L'histoire est bien moins intéressant que celle de Pharaoh et Caesar, alors qu'il y avait pourtant de quoi faire !
- Le narrateur du DLC Poséidon est insupportable, notamment dans une campagne où sa voix est presque inaudible lors des intro/fin de missions à cause d'un effet "vieille bobine" complètement raté
- Musiques oubliables, on est pas au niveau des 3 autres jeux

author: {'steamid': '76561198800705024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 669, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1712065864}
review: Divertente gestionale ambientato nell'antica Grecia. Si costruiscono città, districandosi con nemici, condizioni avverse, dèi benevoli e non, mostri ed eroi.  A volte gli incarichi da svolgere non sono affatto semplici, ma resta un gioco divertente, di grande giocabilità e adatto anche ai ragazzi, che possono divertirsi mentre imparano a conoscere il mondo dell'antica Grecia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258455236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1691242379}
review:
how to make delicious Butter Chicken.
-----------------------------------------------------------
Ingredients for 4 servings,
2 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast (910 g), cubed
salt, to taste
pepper, to taste
2 teaspoons chili powder, divided
½ teaspoon turmeric
6 tablespoons butter, divided
1 ½ cups yellow onion (225 g), diced
3 teaspoons garam masala
1 teaspoon cumin
1 teaspoon cayenne pepper
1 tablespoon ginger, grated
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 cinnamon, 3 inch (8 cm) stick
14 oz tomato sauce (395 g)
1 cup water (240 mL)
1 cup heavy cream (240 mL)
rice, for serving
fresh cilantro, chopped for garnish.

Preparation
In a large bowl, season the chicken breast with salt, pepper, 1 teaspoon of chili powder, and the teaspoon of turmeric. Let
sit for 15 minutes to marinate.
Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a large pot over medium heat. Brown the chicken, then remove from the pot.
Melt another 2 tablespoons of butter in the pot, then add the onion, garam masala, remaining teaspoon of chili powder,
the cumin, ginger, garlic, cayenne, cinnamon, salt and pepper. Cook until fragrant.
Add the tomato sauce and bring to a simmer.
Add the water and cream and return to a simmer.
Return the chicken to the pot, cover, and simmer for another 10-15 minutes.
Stir in the last 2 tablespoons of butter and season with more salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the chicken over rice and garnish with cilantro.
Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198089587362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 81273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71818, 'last_played': 1707903112}
review:
I've been playing this game since I was a kid, so I have a lot of nostalgia related to it--so odds are I'm probably a little biased in favor towards Zeus, but at the same time it does have plenty of objectively good qualities to it.

The only "negative" (?) thing I will say up front is that if you don't like the art style then you'll probably never get past it. Zeus has a very consistent aesthetic that matches its art style, including the voice acting. It isn't childish in its presentation, nor is it serious. It is artistic with a fun and playful edge, with plenty of humor and cheesy references to Greek mythology everywhere, and it doesn't take itself too seriously while still presenting you with many fun challenges. A lot of this game looks and feels hand-drawn, giving it a timeless charm that I still appreciate.

But, if you don't like the art style then you'll probably never really appreciate this game. I played it often as a kid, and its style has always stood out to me as unique and fun.

With that in mind, I would recommend this to anyone who likes city builders with unique mechanics, great challenges, and logistical complexity. Zeus has a fairly low barrier to entry for the easy scenarios, but the later scenarios have a fairly high ceiling of mastery, and not every cookie cutter strategy will work for every map.

This is first and foremost a game of logistics. You have to gather, move, and store resources around the map so you can distribute them to the areas that need them. Basic houses can provide for themselves, but providing food, water, and medical services will allow the houses to evolve to support more citizens. Each level of housing has different needs for resources and services, with culture (science, for Poseidon) being a needed service at various levels, along with the aesthetic appeal of the area being a scaling factor at all levels. If a housing unit loses access to a resource or service, then it will devolve to the level that requires that resource, evicting its residents in the process.

While each scenario has a home city, you will often found colonies throughout the scenario. Each colony has a unique map with different resources. Maps that lack important resources like fleece or olives require vastly different approaches than maps that lack valuable trade resources like marble and bronze, as trading with other cities will be required to fill in the gaps.

Diplomacy with other cities is a minor mechanic, but it can make a big difference when leveraged properly. Giving gifts improves relations, asking for resources degrades relations, and some cities will hate you and try to invade as part of the scenario's story. If you're playing this game right, then you'll have a crap-load of excess resources you can give to your allies to improve relations, which allows you to frequently request resources for free.

Just when I think the game is getting too easy, a harder scenario throws curve balls at me that force me to advance my tactics to keep up, and even I'm not immune to suffering a economic collapses due to supply chain shocks--I've just gotten better at recognizing and responding to them over the years.

These mechanics alone would make for a pretty engaging game, but the addition of disasters, invading armies, gods, and mythical monsters makes many maps even more challenging. 
- Unlike modern games, disasters in Zeus are not random events, but are rather plot points used to permanently deny access to a portion of the map, wiping out parts of your city when they occur. You can't predict them unless you've played the map before, and they don't often happen more than once.
- Invading armies are a nuisance that you must either pay off or defend against using your rabble forces--or elite soldiers if you have dedicated the time and patience to building an elite housing district. Defending with rabble effectively pauses your economy during the invasion, which can be very bad if you're already low on resources like food or fleece, so many times it's better to just pay them off. However, if you build elite housing then you can build up an army and conquer the enemy city, permanently ending the attacks.
- Mythical monsters are part of various scenarios as an obstacle that often prevent you from accessing valuable or essential resources. They are similar to natural disasters, except they can be removed from the map by summoning a hero to slay them. Which hero must be summoned depends upon the monster, and each hero has different needs. Some are fairly easy to summon, others are ridiculously demanding (lookin' at you Jason!). Fortunately, monsters don't wander outside their spawn zone, so they primarily serve as an Area-of-Denial mechanic--but they can be accidentally led away from the zone by citizens if you have roads too close to them.
- Gods and goddesses are always visiting to get you to build temples to them so your people can worship them, which they will provide benefits for doing so. The most useful ones provide resources you otherwise don't have access to, and two (Artemis and Ares) provide special soldier units. However, some scenarios involve certain gods attacking your city, which often require building a temple to another god for protection, or completing the scenario and moving on to another city. Sadly, in every modern port of Zeus I've played the gods are terribly bugged such that their animations are *extremely* slow to the point that they can't always make a meaningful difference when they are needed.

Every time I play Zeus I keep thinking I should be bored of the game by now. I've long since mastered the game loop to the point that I can explain my exact strategy for it, and I have techniques for keeping things from spiraling out of control while creating so much excess that money ceases to be a concern (and pacifism becomes simpler than defending my territory). Yet, I still find this game deeply satisfying and enjoyable to play, and for more than just nostalgic value. It is objectively a well-polished and mechanically complex game, one with a low floor of entry and a high ceiling of mastery, with enough content to keep you engaged for 1000+ hours.

Somehow, when I'm bored of all other games on my list--both modern and from my youth--I always come back to Zeus and find myself enjoying every minute of it, even though I've been playing this game for (probably?) 20 years now. The stories are fun and lighthearted, the game mechanics have held up very well since the game launched, the art style is unique and matches the game's overall aesthetic (again, it's not for everyone), and the scenarios present many challenges that even a seasoned Zeus veteran like myself still find engaging.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991002760', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1872, 'last_played': 1680886050}
review:
Un clásico entre los clásicos, el último de la serie de city builders de Impression Games (los cuales son todos una maravilla) y por tanto el más pulido y satisfactorio. 
El aspecto central del juego es el económico, aunque tiene su parte bélica e incluso tendrás que tener a los dioses del Olimpo contentos para que te bendigan y te ayuden en tus gestas, así como atraer héroes clásicos para cumplir misiones divinas, sirviéndote también como apoyo militar en las batallas y conquistas del mundo panhelénico. 
Dispone de varias campañas y otra más con la expansión de Poseidón, que incluye temática de la Atlántida cambiando las artes griegas por la ciencia y añade un pedazo de circuito de carreras de cuádrigas que puedes colocar entre la propia ciudad. Bastante brutal.
Recomiendo buscar la traducción y voces al castellano y parchearlo para disfrutar del doblaje brutal que tenía, como casi todos los juegos que publicaba Sierra Entertainment.
Que no te echen para atrás los gráficos desactualizados, una vez te pones son encantadores. Hazte un favor y juega esta obra maestra de los juegos de construcción de ciudades.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004113670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1699850998}
review: Zeus is the moment in which Impressions gave into the normies and gave up.  Pharaoh is utterly perfect and I could see if you want to argue that Caesar 3 is too rough around the edges and difficult.  The base game is way too easy now and all they did was slap artificial difficulty on top via some time wasters and unfair map restarts.  There is way way way too much obsession in Zeus with "godz".  Every city has an enemy god or animal that you have to slay, and to do so you have to summon a friendly god.  You don't get to summon one nor can you know what you will need in advance to summon one, until the enemy shows up, which means you spend 4 in-game years listening to the battle music on loop while you desperately get the things you need to summon your godz.  This along with that the enemy god spawns at some random place on the map, most probably over your city, means that you are just going to have to restart a mission a bunch of times.  Distribution is much stupider and backwards from Pharaoh - you have to place individual shops in market agoras now, and there is LITERALLY not even a single time that I didn't place all three - why make the player do this?  Trade is worse too - you have to buy one trading post or pier PER city you want to trade with.  So stupid.  You also don't have the handy little list like you did in Pharaoh to show which commodities exist for import or export, so you have to spend 5 minutes at the start of a new mission to hunt around for all the cities and make a list in your head.  Literally basic goods that you need to get more than 10 minutes into a mission must be imported from other cities.  HOW many times is a mission not going to offer fleece?  This means you can't upgrade your housing past the second level without imports.  What a joke.  The extreme reliance on imports also makes your city vulnerable, I cannot tell you how many times suddenly my city went from 1500 workers to 200 because somehow the fleeced did not get delivered.  If you look up online guides, they all say to purposefully not fulfill the objectives in the first few missions and let the game time run on so you can accumulate money for the next missions.  Some of them appear to be impossible unless you do this.  They like to pretend they are giving you a "choice" in which mission/colony you start next but there is always one that is way way too easy, and one that is way way too hard unless you conquer all the other cities first (by way of choosing those easier colonies instead), which can cause you to RESTART THE ENTIRE ADVENTURE which means playing through the last 4 levels OVER AGAIN.  This is the mark of a poorly designed game.  Sadly, Emperor seems to be a repeat of what we see here as well.  Zeus is very very badly designed and I'm very sad about that because I was hoping for two good sequels to Pharaoh.  I can now see why C3Heaven has a boatload of maps for C3 and Pharaoh but not nearly as many for Zeus or Emperor.  All Impressions had to do here was do a repeat of Pharaoh but they tried to dumb down the game and introduce lame new mechanics that take us backward.  The only partially good thing I can say about Zeus or Emperor is that they are the easiest Impressions City Builders to get started with, but they are not very rewarding to play.  The tutorials in Zeus/Emperor are also garbage - C3 did it better 5 years earlier.  The tutorials in Zeus are just a bunch of scrolling text that quite literally tell you to go do something and come back, instead of the C3/Pharaoh ones popping up intelligently when you did it.  Pharaoh is the best game in the series by a longshot because it takes everything that made C3 good, beefs up the market buyers' intelligence, and is rewarding to play.  When I see people recommending Zeus it always turns out that it was their first and ONLY game in the series, they had it when they were a kid, and they haven't played anything else.  Avoid Zeus and Emperor and start with Pharaoh.

author: {'steamid': '76561199531594294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2558, 'last_played': 1709955605}
review:
This was purely a nostalgia purchase for me which is why I downloaded it 25 years later! Because I enjoy the simplicity, theme, and overall flow of game play. Sure it's old AF and the graphics are to be expected for the late 90s but, this as well as Pharoh,  are still some of my favorite city building games to play. I play this longer and more often than I have the SimCity franchise and I am a Sims OG (Beta).   It is straight forward, doesn't have a million cheats. Overall, Zeus and Poseidon can be chill or challenging, has some quirks since its older, but will be playing this as long as I am able to find it on a platform over the next few decades too.
Side note:  (I do miss having a mouse vs a track pad while playing on my laptop at times since it uses right click pretty heavily and I have smaller hands.Ex:  zoom in and out motion scrolls instead but it was easy to adjust to after a little adjustment.   play

review: Играл в детстве. Потом перед университетом, когда было свободное время. Теперь решил в стиме купить, немного построить древние города, вспомнить то самое детство. На самом деле, для своего времени, великолепная градостроительная игра. Нравилось, буквально, все, кроме военной части - она тут примитивная и кривая. Надо было или доделывать нормально, или убирать и делать всю игру просто про строительство. Если вы никогда до этого не играли в эту игру, такая цена вполне себе "стоит того".

author: {'steamid': '76561198012788044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1688861774}
review:
Uno pensaría que un juego de hace tanto tiempo, si lo pones a la venta en steam para seguir monetizandolo, es porque es compatible. Pues no del todo. 
Hay un bug con las animaciones, especialmente grave con los dioses y los heroes, que hace que se muevan a una velocidad de 1/10 de la adecuada a veces, lo que genera interacciones erroneas. 
Si ya jugaste a este juego y te gusto, seguramente te parecera un precio razonable por la nostalgia. Si nunca has jugado a el, hay juegos sin bugs en el mercado por precios similares.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006542001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1696358578}
review:
I've spent countless hours playing this game on boxed original cd edition..they surely don't make them like this no more, I still remember how excited I was unpacking it and reading the illustrated manual book..memories!
Ancient Greece and its mythology are still my favourite ones and this game by far remains my dearest Impressions antic city simulator game. It is fun and playable with decent graphics still up to this time and great campaigns. 
Combining mythological elements with creatures, famous heroes and greek pantheon gods with historical ones and with lots of humour and plenty of excellent captured atmosphere creates excellent gaming experience

author: {'steamid': '76561198089381781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1696206734}
review:
Where do I even begin? Nay-I-Say to the Nay-Sayers, this game is a national treasure. Nic Cage himself would do whatever it takes to keep this game on the Steam store. It would be a sin against God if this game were to ever be taken down. 

The nostalgia hit that comes with this game is unlike any other. Master Chief? Bitch compared to Zeus. Banjo-Kazooie? Bitches compares to Zeus. Crash Bandicoot? Absolute bitch compared to Zeus. 

Don't even get me started on the Poseidon expansion pack. Back in my day DLC was worth the price. I'd pay $99.99 for this DLC. Why isn't there a Zeus + Poseidon skin in Fortnite? Children across the world need to be educated on what a good game is. I propose into Congress that instead of food and water for the poor Ugandans, that we provide them with Chromebooks and this game. We defeated the Nazis so this game could thrive. Wasn't this what the Civil Rights Movement was all about? MLK, Zeus all day. 

I currently have 402 EC2 instances on AWS running this game. My bill is approximately $13,497 a month to do this. My wife left me. But Zeus is with me, always. 

There is only two genders: Zeus + Poseidon.

review: I have played this game off and on for 12 years. I love it, and still replay it. The simple yet thought provoking game play mechanics, progressive campaign difficulty and varying design potential of each city has made this one of my favorite games of all time. author: {'steamid': '76561198078173133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3262, 'last_played': 1705256299}
review:
I've played Zeus a long time ago, maybe 2008 or so. Even back then I loved it so I eventually got it on Steam for nostalgia.

The adventures have adjustible difficulty settings so you can choose between getting creative without worries or limiting yourself to having to min-max everything and carefully handle your resources.

One problem I have is that gods often appear with about 0.5fps and it takes a while for their spawning animation to complete. I asked Apollo to defeat an attacking monster only for him to manifest so slowly that he got defeated before delivering a single strike. That process repeated around 10 times before I got the appropriate hero to defeat the monster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198885324736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1681835223}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094986959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1918, 'last_played': 1700998272}
review: If you only play one classic from the  city sim genre, make it this one. The combination of excellent music, witty humour, and balanced gameplay means you'll be absolutely hooked on it. I've got the shiniest modern games waiting for me in my steam library and yet this is the one I always go back to.And at this price? Come on now.My only wish is that they updated the code a little for modern day devices, to allow for things like streaming gameplay, or second-screen support (my game goes black whenever I try either of these things). It'd be great to be able to stream this and introduce a new generation to this gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997935812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2818, 'last_played': 1704403470}
review:
This game is quite old and it really does show with the graphics and also game play. The game is really limited for example you can't micro manage some of the aspects of city building.  With workers, you can choose which industries to prioritise so when the population drops, then those industries are fully staffed but the population control is erratic so for example higher residence such as the Townhouse (which is the highest evolution of a house for normal citizens) require access to all culture including Competitors which will only appear when you have a Stadium but the placement of stadium is critical because those silly competitors tend to walk the shortest distance to the stadium from a Gymnasium. So If there are no houses in between the gym and the stadium, they will devolve and you lose population as they have no access to a competitor.

This brings me to my next point, you cannot control the path of your Culture characters like Actors, Philosophers, Athletes and Competitors which means once you find the best optimal town building path then you're screwed because the game becomes boring and its copy and paste. 

I hope someone out there might get a mod of Zeus on the game Banished or something. That'd be quite interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063433544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 936, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1678029834}
review: Was für ein schmutz,ändert man die Sprache mit dem Patch dann funkktioniert das halbe Spiel nicht mehr, ändert man die Auflösung mit dem Patch dann kann man nicht auf "Deutsch" spielen, ändert man hin und her geht gar nichts mehr. Ab ins Grab mit dir Zeus und Konsorten!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082921406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13405, 'last_played': 1705239595}
review:
Pour les fans des jeux de gestion et construction de ville, celui ci est un des premiers ! des centaines d'heures de jeu à mon actif sur la version physique à l'époque, et encore quelques centaines sur steam pour ma part. 

je crois que je peux dire que j'ai rentabilisé le jeu en 23 ans. 

je peux ne pas y jouer pendant deux ans, je sais que un jour ou l'autre je le relancerai pour repartir construire Atlantis ou Athènes, et galérer à trouver de la place pour construire le temple de Zeus !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055763586', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1373, 'last_played': 1675185063}
review:
Questo gioco appartiene alla mia - nostra - infanzia. E' un RTS derivante dalla serie Caesar. Qui controlleremo una città stato Greca e le sue colonie. Essendo ambientata in un'età mitica, ci ritroveremo fra i piedi, oltre ad innumerevoli disastri naturali, dei, mostri e eroi, con tutto quello che ne comporta.

Ogni sua campagna ha una propria longevità e un livello di sfida ben distribuito, con anche notevoli sorprese (in negativo) per il giocatore che volesse correre troppo. Per ogni scenario è bene valutare il terreno su cui sorgerà la città e solo successivamente sviluppare bene la città.

Che altro dire, la grafica è quella che è, manca la lingua italiana (anche se chi ha il CD ricorderà che era localizzato in italiano), però diavolo, a me mancano giochi così.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110377890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 21153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20404, 'last_played': 1676184704}
review: Maybe it was because I was raised on this game, but every city builder I've played pales in comparison to this one. I've played every campaign through four times over the past decade, about to go back for round 5. Game devs take note - THIS is how you make a city builder!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971434959', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1672541355}
review:
Zeus + Poseidon is a fun and addictive city-building game that allows you to build and manage your own ancient Greek city. The game has a deep building and resource management system, with a variety of structures and resources to gather and utilize. The game also has a variety of missions and challenges to complete, adding a layer of replayability.
One of the standout features of Zeus + Poseidon is its god powers. As you progress through the game, you'll be able to unlock various god powers that allow you to influence the world around you. You can use these powers to help your city grow and prosper, or to smite your enemies. It's a fun and unique feature that adds a lot of depth to the game.
The graphics in Zeus + Poseidon are decent, with detailed character models and environments. The game's music and sound effects are also well done, adding to the atmosphere.
One downside to Zeus + Poseidon is that the game can be a bit slow at times. It can take a while for your city to grow and generate income, and you might find yourself waiting for resources to accumulate. This can be frustrating, especially if you're used to faster-paced city-building games.
Overall, Zeus + Poseidon is a fun and enjoyable city-building game that's a lot of fun to play. Its deep building and resource management system, variety of missions and challenges, and fun god powers make it a game that's worth checking out. The slow pace can be a bit of an issue, but it doesn't really impact the overall enjoyment of the game. If you're a fan of city-building games, you should definitely give Zeus + Poseidon a try.

review:
[u][h1] เกมตำนานที่อยู่ในดวงใจ [/h1][/u]
[b] สารภาพบาป [/b]
[list] 
 [*] เป็นเกมที่สมัยเด็กติดเอาหนักมากๆชอบจนต้องเอา [spoiler] แผ่น(ไม่แท้) [/spoiler] 
  ไปนั่งเล่นที่ห้องคอมโรงเรียนหรือบ้านเพื่อน
 [*][spoiler] ไลท์แผ่นแท้จากเพื่อนอีกทีมาเก็บไว้เล่นเอง [/spoiler]
 [*] ซื้อไถ่บาปตั้งแต่ตัวเกมประกาศวางขายใน steam
[/list]

[b] 9.5/10 [/b]
 [list] 
  [*]ภาพ 16bit ไม่ได้แย่เลย งานอาร์ตก็สวยอยู่นะ 
  [*]จัดสรรทรัพยากร บริหารบ้านเมืองให้รอด(ระดับบยากสุดเล่นไม่เคยรอด)
  [*]สร้างกองทัพไปยึดเมืองมันส่ะถ้ามันสร้างความรำคาญให้เมืองเรา
  [*]งบดุล(เงินในเกม)ไม่ใช่ปัญหาในการเล่น ถ้าจัดสรรการ นำเข้า/ส่งออกดีๆ และ [strike]ภาษีจากปชช.!!![/strike]
 [/list]

[b] เป็นเกมในดวงใจ ของใครหลายๆคน แนะนำครับ [/b]
ซื้อมาเก็บก็ยังไม่เสียหาย ซื้อมาเล่นก็เพลินจนลืมหูลืมตาไปลยครับ

ปล.
 [list]
  [*]ไม่ support Wide screen มีแค่ 800*600 กับ 1024*768
  [*]ไม่ support ภาษาไทย เพราะเป็นตัวเกมจากทางฝั่ง ENG
  [*]Run on Win10&Win11 ได้ไม่มีปัญหา(win11เป็นข้อมูลจาก steam commu)

สำหรับใครอยากเล่นแบบภาษาไทย จะมีคนแจกไฟล์ภาษาไทยให้อยู่
ลงทับของเดิม ตัวเกมเล่นได้ปกติ แต่ข้อความแจ้งเตือนในเกมจะไม่ขึ้น

สำหรับใครอยากเล่นแบบ wide screen 1920*1080 ให้ลง mod ตามลิงค์ที่แปะไว้
*ย้ำว่าห้ามเปลี่ยนแปลงไฟล์ในเกมก่อนจะลง [u] ใช้ร่วมกับไฟล์ภาษาไทยไม่ได้ [/u]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/zeusmasterofolympus/mods/1?tab=images] Link [/url]

setting ในการันตัวเกม เพิ่มเติม
โฟล์เดอร์ตัวเกม Zeus + Poseidon>>Zeus.exe>>Properties>>Compatibility>>ตื๊ก Reduced color mode >> 16 bit(65538)color
>>Change high DPI setting>>High DPI scaling override>>ติ๊ก Override high DPI scaling behavior>> Application

ส่วนใครที่เบื่อ map เดิมๆจิ้มไปโหลด map เพิ่มเติมได้ที่
[url=https://zeus.heavengames.com/downloads/lister.php?category=adventures_pos] Link [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198000825662', 'num_games_owned': 1221, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1662645835}
review:
Nachdem Freunde, welche das Spiel schon seit ihrer Kindheit spielten, immer wieder von diesem Spiel "Zeus: Herrscher des Olymp" geschwärmt haben, habe ich mich auch mal daran versucht.

Das Problem:
Das Spiel ist ALT. Und nicht "von 2016"-alt, wie einem Steam weismachen möchte, sondern "von 2000"-alt.
Und leider altern manche Spiele mMn nicht gut.
Ich finde es sehr kompliziert und an vielen Stellen einfach langweilig, da ich nur bedingt verstehe, "WAS" "WARUM" gerade passiert oder "WARUM eben NICHT".
Da mir der Nostalgiefaktor fehlt, kann ich das Spiel nicht empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198878619436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 9489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9489, 'last_played': 1565675292}
review:
Awesome game, dont know why it says its from 2016, its FAR older, i played it when i was a child (much to the detriment of my restults)
If you are here and you dont know what this is (dont know how would you), its an AWESOME city sim with a lot of fun mechanincs.  You'll need to desing your city to optimize the services to your citizens, dont worry, you'll git gud at it, you will also have to conquer other places, defend your territories, build temples, gain the favor of gods (all supported by very visual, hands on mechanics from them), summon heroes to your cause, employ or fight the servants of gods.... by the time you finish  the campaings, you'll feel the weight and the joy of the journey... TRY THIS GAME, you wont regret it

review: From the first time I played in 2005 to now, still a great little game. I wish it had some modern patches for screen resolution and controls, but it is definitely a product of its time. I recommend turning off ambient noise (just so you don't hear "Does anybody have my spear? How can I be a spear carrier without my spear?" for the 80th time in a minute), but I find the other voice-over dialogue to be completely charming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174214629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1548123594}
review: I played this game my entire childhood. I will never understand why no one actually sits down and uses the myths and legends as they're written. Their stories have already survived 1 thousand years longer than anything most of the story writers will ever dream of in today's world. This game was a great and welcome update. It runs well and it's just as fun as I remember.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982952265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3973, 'last_played': 1623596143}
review: This was the first PC game I ever owned.  I always thought of it as the sleeper that no-one knew about so it really feels good to see that so many others loved it as much as I did.  My review is thus...BUY THIS GAME.  You have not lived until Dionysus has has led all of your citizens out of of the city in a toga line.  Once you have completed all the built-in content, visit Zeus Haven for hundreds of user created maps and scenarios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078480508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1967, 'last_played': 1700028373}
review:
Un vieux jeu, certes, mais qui sait être très plaisant, parfois ardu. On peut encore parfaitement s'y plonger de nos jours pour de très longues heures. C'est parfois difficile surtout dans des scénars aux cartes minuscules mais avec un peu d'expérience on apprend quelques astuces pour optimiser. Le style dessiné de l'interface et des personnage me plaît mais je suppose qu'il ne conviendra pas à tout le monde. 
L'extension Poséidon ajoute vraiment pas mal de contenu et diversifie un peu le jeu, c'est d'ailleurs ma partie favorite.
Ce jeu convient aux jeunes dès la dizaine et permet à la fois d'explorer un peu la mythologie grecque en s'amusant mais également à se lancer dans les jeux de gestion.
Je conseille le patch FR de Yanka, ça marche très bien et permet de retrouver les dialogues des citoyens en français. Certains d'entre eux sont très drôles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143076929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2813, 'last_played': 1607447938}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027333824', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1690008907}
review:
There is a mild problem of the game being from the stone age, but it's fixable with some searching.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137759247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1709428370}
review:
It's an oldie but a goodie, it's your classic city builder with an ancient Greece flair. I've revisited this game a number of times over the years, and despite its age it's still just a fun game to play. 

Each single player adventure consists of a number of "episodes" that has specific goals for you to meet; it could be as something simple as "collect 32 sheaves of wheat" to something more complicated like "conquer three other rival cities". 

To spice it up, however, you get to deal with some of the gods and monsters from Greek mythology. You may suddenly find a chunk of your city on fire because Hephaestus came calling, or maybe Hades will unleash his two headed dog on you just for grins. But fear not, you also have the ability to build sanctuaries to other gods and heroes, who will grant their favors on your city and do battle with the nasties that have come to play.

All in all, it's just a fun, casual builder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087577535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1655420371}
review:
I've been playing on and off for almost 10 years now (on multiple computers and platforms), and I must say, this game always has a way to pull you back in. It's a strong, and sometimes ruthless strategy game, with simple yet elegant graphics. I have yet to find a modern that scratches the city building itch like this one does.

Strongly recommend.

review: Unfortunately this game was ported poorly. No attention to graphical scaling, ratio aspects or any other textures was given, the game has many problems on newer systems and stability is a bit of an issue. The game play is fine, but because they didn't port it for newer higher end graphics machines it shows tearing and odd visual glitches, while getting it dialed in to read and not have parts of the screen cut off are a bit tedious. Overall a fantastic classic city builder but a bad emulated port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257181620', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1651098930}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970500236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 22705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22668, 'last_played': 1651866960}
review:
A friend of mine worked at Impressions and bought me a copy when this game was first released.   I wasn't too sure about it, but took up his offer and installed it.  It's not a big splashy combat game, but as kind of mellow SimCity with some military elements in it as it relates to the Greek myths.  You fight for, with or against a variety of gods from Mount Olympus as you follow the classic Greek myths like Jason and the Golden Fleece, or the Labors of Hercules and so forth.  

The graphics, by today's standards, are passable yet somewhat dated and comparatively "low resolution" with more modern SimCity like games out on the market, and an update to the graphics would be welcome, but the game plays well enough all the same.

Zeus and its expansion Poseidon is one of those games that you try on a whim and aren't sure what you'll get, but wind up being pleasantly surprised because it's new, familiar and unique all at once, and keeps you interested in building an ancient Greek town and city.  At the same time it does get marginally tedious at times as your traded goods and town requirements seem to tax your attention, but then again that is kind of the point of the game.

Keith Zizza's marvelous scoring talents adorn this game with some very atmospheric Ancient Greek like music.  In quieter times you hear a lyre plucked in harmony with flutes and ethereal howls of the mystic that is the Greek pantheon.  At other times when you're invaded or attacked by a monster the music transforms into a challenging march to accentuate the danger.  It's really classic Keith Zizza at his best.  

All in all I enjoyed this game, and still think it's worth a look, though some younger players may get somewhat impatient with its sprite based graphics.  Either way, for me at least, it was a fun ride.  Check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117634382', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1691503575}

author: {'steamid': '76561198181033169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8248, 'last_played': 1646767826}
review:
I grew up with this game, the hours logged in Steam are a small fraction of the reality. For me, it's still the best city-builder ever made.

[h1]Good stuff:[/h1]
- [b]Fast gameplay.[/b] Apart from the notable exception of sanctuaries, buildings are placed fully formed and the only resource you need is money (which is easy to come by). This means you can hit pause, build your entire city and then just watch it fill with people. Compared to many other city builders, there is very little grind.

- [b]Humour and dialogue.[/b] It's worth getting the game just for the narration of the adventures alone. The scripts themselves are excellent and the narrator does some very entertaining "impressions" of gods, heroes, philosophers etc. If you right-click your citizens then they will make a lot puns and references to Greek history/mythology and also a few pop-culture references. They all have unique voices and the dialogue will change depending on how happy they are.

- [b]Stories.[/b] Many modern city-builders only have a sandbox mode with randomly generated maps. While this provides potentially endless gameplay, the reality is that once you've learned all the mechanics, it can get boring. Zeus comes with a whole load of adventures which follow the stories of Ancient Greece and provide you with actual end goals. Each adventure also comes with unique maps and challenges that have been carefully thought out.

- [b]The mythology.[/b] Build a sanctuary to a god and they'll wander around your city blessing buildings, wiping out armies or beating up enemy gods. Monsters will appear and start causing havoc until you summon a hero to slay them. Oh and of course they all come with their own unique dialogue. It's a lot of fun and you'll also learn quite a lot about Greek mythology.

[h1]Bad stuff:[/h1]
- [b]Limited mechanics.[/b] This is not going to be problem for the vast majority of people. However, if you are interested in micro-managing every aspect of your city and building really extensive production lines and trade routes then you may find yourself a bit limited. There is some level of resource and worker management but industries are very linear and you can't control the exact number of workers in a building for example. Trade is very straightforward. The flip side is that the behaviour of everything in the game is simple and highly predictable which means you can go very deep into building the most optimal cities possible.

- [b]Age[/b]. The game is is 20 years old now which means you'll want to download the patch that lets you play full screen and fixes some animation issues. Texture and audio quality obviously isn't what it would be today. There is also a hard limit on the number of sprites which prevents truly massive cities. You can still make them much larger than you'll ever actually need though.

- [b]Military[/b]. Military is not a primary focus of the game but it is certainly a meaningful aspect. They went to the effort of giving the different units a variety of tactics but for the most part, they are useless. Winning a fight basically just comes down to having a bigger army and most of the time, the best option is just to bribe invaders to go away

- [b]Imbalanced gods[/b]. This has always bothered me - building sanctuaries to the big boys (Zeus, Poseidon, Hades etc) is almost always a waste of time. The lesser gods are [b]much[/b] more useful and require far less resource. I have never understood why the "late game" gods weren't given more power.

If you're into city builders, buy this game. If you're into Greek myths, buy this game. Just buy this game.

review:
The legendary city builder. Originally came with my first PC, my whole family has played it to death. 
It captures a sense of Greek culture and feeling that I have never, ever seen elsewhere. It's very unique and worth playing.
For some reason the ambient noise of the wind is etched into my mind so deeply that when I think of "the winds of change" blowing or the cycle of life and death and my own mortality, I hear it playing in my head.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105906662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 5514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2664, 'last_played': 1689614177}
review:
LO RECOMIENDO?: Si.
TE JODE QUE ESTE EN INGLES?: Hay un patch en la web sencillo para traducirlo.
Por que lo recomiendo?: Porque es un viaje SINGLE PLAYER a disfrutar un juego maravilloso. Sin combates freneticos ni hacks. Tiene su dificultad porque todo depende de una cadena previa. Si para un edificio necesitas marmol y tu mapa no tiene, pero producis aceite de oliva que se vende cara, podes dedicarte a la produccion de aceite para conseguir el dinero e importar el marmol. Pero ojo, tal vez las ciudades vecinas no quieran aceite de oliva pero si aceitunas, entonces no vendes el producto industrializado sino la materia prima. Y asi, es todo un juego de ingenio, sencillo, pero con la dosis justa de desafio para no aburrirte ni frustrate.
El combate es flojo pero la gestion de las invasiones es entrenido. 
Los dioses, heroes y criaturas son un show. Podes tenerlos a favor o en contra y en contra, cualquiera, es un bajon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995596101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1484338209}
review: Zeus tweaks the already established, at that point, formula that Impressions had been working with in some clever ways but it is not as monumental as Pharaoh or as focused on pure city creation as Caesar 3. I still played the game a ton when I was younger. I was also convinced that the developer would find a way to merge its new ideas with the more established elements of the genre. Unfortunately, no one has created Caesar 5 until now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234225572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1708463999}
review: Świetna gierka, rodzice kupili mi ją na premierę czyli ponad 20 lat temu. Do dziś co jakiś czas do niej wracam. Z city builderów od Impressions Games to chyba Zeus ma najlepszą grafikę (a na pewno najczytelnijeszą). Gra się przyjemnie, starcza na długo, w necie jest mnóstwo scenariuszy do ściągnięcie. Jak ktoś lubi klimaty mitologi greckiej to poczuje się jak w domu. Różne mity zostały bardzo sprytnie przekute na grę ekonomiczną. Szczerze polecam, przez całe swoje życie miałem 6 PC lub laptopów, na każdym był Zeus ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198046675266', 'num_games_owned': 1540, 'num_reviews': 1124, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1641177382}
review:
[h1]This game contains [i]Zeus: Master of Olympus (2000)[/i] and it's expansion [i]Poseidon: Master of Atlantis (2001)[/i], which is why it's just called Zeus + Poseidon on Steam.

It's identical to Pharaoh + Cleopatra but with a whole Greek mythology feel.

If you enjoy city building simulations definitely check it out!

7/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561199015262492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16401, 'last_played': 1704382611}

author: {'steamid': '76561198362790881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2332, 'last_played': 1682369579}
review: Ho avuto un attacco di nostalgia improvvisa frugando in mezzo alle vecchie scatole dei videogiochi e ho davvero incrociato le dita nella speranza di ritrovare "Zeus - Il Signore dell'Olimpo" su Steam. Peccato per l'audio in italiano perché mi faceva spaccare dalle risate, ma anche in inglese è decisamente divertente. Forse dal prezzo si potevano scalare ancora un paio d'euro, ma non mi sono affatto pentita di averlo acquistato: mi ci sono chiusa immediatamente e mi sto divertendo parecchio, lo consiglio a tutti i nostalgici dei gestionali vecchio stile e sto già allungando l'occhio su Pharaoh...

author: {'steamid': '76561197994819738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1640516185}
review:
Mega klasyk na dziesiątki godzin gry. 
Polecam młodszym też by wczuć się w klimat mitologii.
Świetna strategia dla każdego. Aż nie wierze, że powstała 20 lat temu !

review:
Probablement la plus belle réussite dans le style city builder (gestion & construction de cité) particulié à Impressions Games: Un patch de la VF d'origine (quasi' complet) se trouve facilement sur le net, il faudra aussi utiliser le logiciel BES (battle encoder shirasé) pour empêcher le bug des dieux qui apparaissent trop lentement ! (le paramétrage dépendra de votre config PC, target -35%, ms 40 sur mon i5 à 8gb ram).

Pensez aussi une fois en jeu à changer l'affichage pour que ce soit un peu dézoomé ! ^^ Ce sera clairement plus agréable à jouer :)

Bon jeu à vous ;p

author: {'steamid': '76561198340772716', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1702146104}
review: Ich kenne das Spiel noch aus den guten alten Windows 95/98er Zeiten und habe es damals geliebt! Deshalb habe ich mich auch sehr gefreut, als ich gesehen habe, dass es auf Steam zu kaufen ist. Wer Städtebau-Spiele und das antike Griechenland mag, der sollte sich das Spiel unbedingt anschauen. Götter besuchen die Stadt, die man gerade aufbaut und wenn man Glück hat, segnen sie die Stadt. Wenn man Pech hat, sind sie aber auch schon mal sauer und schicken ein Monster, dass dann auf der Map rumwütet. Aber für solche kleinen Missgeschicke kann man einen Helden herbeirufen, der sich der Sache annimmt. Man kann mit anderen Städten handeln, um Waren zu erhalten, die man selbst nicht hat, bei Wettkämpfen mitmachen und die Stadt beim Wachsen bewundern. Natürlich wäre das alles zu einfach, wenn nicht andere Städte zwischendurch meinen, Ansprüche stellen zu müssen und in der Stadt einzufallen... Oder es grassiert wieder mal die Pest. Aber wer sich davon nicht abhalten lässt, wird viele schöne Stunden in diesem Spiel verbringen können.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352652308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1638548416}
review: I used to play this when  I was 7. The best strategic game ever which existed even before AOE or AOM,  so nostalgic.  Be it building houses from settlements, increasing populations, building agoras with fleece , food and oil suppliers, increasing the appeal of the neighborhood to bring in more people into your houses, setting up sheeps for wool or vineyard for wine, this game has everything that an ancient Roman city ever had. I love how you can transform a small settlement into huge towns with proper strategic supplying of items. Also the mythology in the game is fascinating, there are loads of gods, for each you have to build a monument of sorts. Military to defend your city has to be built from scratch with proper supply of iron or copper. This game has the best music set , if you had a long day losing on multiplayer games such as valorant or brawlhalla which makes you wanna smash your monitor, play this game so that you can chill the f out and not waste your money on a new monitor xD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065457822', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3958, 'last_played': 1701470264}
review: Build me a pyre to roast my friends upon

author: {'steamid': '76561198006918265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1585836562}
review: This game moulded me into the God I am today. In all seriousness Zeus is a beautiful meditative experience and revisiting it  was a blast from the past. I used to re-watch the opening credits of this game in my head every night before bed as a 10 yaer old kid. I never understood the military system, raising rabbles, or really anything besides my overwhelming desire for marble so I could woo all the divine beings to my city full of plague and random fires. Couple slight issues running such an old game on a new computer but worth your time regardless if you've any desire to walk down nostalgia lane.

review: I love strategy/simulation games and I still find this one fun and challenging at age 29. There's a bit of a learning curve in the beginning (maintenance buildings to prevent collapses/fires, road blocks to manage foot traffic, placing storage facilities close enough to agoras/trading posts/manufacturing, bridges, where to put the elites versus the peasants haha, balancing income from taxes/exports versus expenses). Persist though!

review:
Brilliant God-Sim both as a standalone and featuring Ancient Greek Mythology. Graphics a little dated now but gameplay and content makes up for it.

+ Greek Mythology
+ Enjoyable building mechanics & gameplay
+ Fun quests (side missions)
+ Great voice/SFX/Music

- Graphics showing their age

author: {'steamid': '76561197991728762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1609158392}
review: Jedna z gier mojego dzieciństwa a jednocześnie jedna z niewielu, która po latach wciąż nie straciła swojego uroku. Po instalacji trzeba co prawda chwilę się pomęczyć by zagrać w wysokiej rozdzielczości i z polskimi głosami (lokalizacja jest świetna, naprawdę warto poświęcić kilka minut) ale w nagrodę otrzymujemy jednego z najlepszych city builderów jakie kiedykolwiek powstały. Można wymieniać wiele zalet Zeusa, ale to z czym mi kojarzy się najbardziej to przyjemność. Budowa miast jest najzwyczajniej relaksująca, zabawna i dająca wiele satysfakcji. Warto dać szansę jeśli ktoś nie grał, warto wrócić jeśli ktoś, podobnie jak ja, grał 20 lat temu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998382387', 'num_games_owned': 1541, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1631439017}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970237665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 3456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3008, 'last_played': 1630706022}
review:
Zeus, and the expansion Poseidon, are among the elderly city building sims from impression. If you’re unfamiliar, the base idea of the genre is to construct a city by housing, feeding, entertaining, and providing work for the immigrant denizens. Each scenario will provide you with limitations to one or more of these resources in some way you need to overcome through strategy.  On the whole, the genre offers something that feels a little more personal than simcity or civilisation type games. Z&P are somewhat different to the others in the genre I’ve played, with their greater focus on heroes and gods, all round more streamlined and easier gameplay, and slightly better pathfinding.

Pros:
The game is much easier to handle than earlier incarnations. 
There are some improvements to UI on previous incarnations. 
The music, voice acting, and feel of the game remain intact, even after all these years.

Cons:
The game suffers in some ways from its simplicity. By making the game ‘friendlier’ much of the challenge that many veterans of the genre enjoy has been stripped away. 
The game comes from a day when tutorials weren’t a thing, we had these large archaic ‘tomes’ where words were carefully painted on mashed up corpses of trees. These ancient methods of communicated are mostly lost to time, the information and glorious smells lost forever. (Unless googled, or you click the download manual button… but ain’t nobody got time fo’ dat.) This means the instructions for new comers are sorely lacking.
The game suffers from a lot of the problems of the genre as a whole, from the pathfinding of the delivery AI’s and soldiers, to the overpowered ways these can be gamed to beat the game in a way probably not intended. 

Suggested improvements:
Open this to the workshop. It came with a level editor back in the day, it’s probably still in the game. Let the community share its creations and breath more life into this old gem.
Add a tutorial for newcomers to the genre, it wouldn’t take much.
More information on supply lines, spending, optimal numbers, etc would really be welcome. How many vines to huts, how many wineries will that feed? Ya know, things I’m too lazy to work out.

Overall Recommendation:
Z&P is a great entry level city builder, it’s streamlined, friendly, still enjoyable, and would definitely help a newcomer to cut their teeth. For vets it offers more of the same oldschool gameplay we’ve been milking for about 25 years in a calm and chilled out form. It’s a great old game and still worth picking up today.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358999504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 135079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53529, 'last_played': 1710312936}
review: Zeus and its sequel Poseidon are two of the best community building games.  When I started playing them, I stopped playing games like Civilization.  You build ancient Greek and Atlantean cities, respectively.  You get to task Greek heroes with completing missions, including killing Greek monsters right in town.  Your worshiped gods will also either walk around town while enemy gods will invade.  It is very true to myths, e.g., you call appropriate heroes to fight monsters from their myths, and myths have the right gods as enemies versus friendlies. For example, in the Trojan war campaigns, the gods who were enemies or friends are the same as the ones who supported the Greeks vs. the Trojans.  I love mythology, but I would love this game anyway.  I played it was first released and I was so glad to find it on Steam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024761029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9276, 'last_played': 1685916705}
review:
Un titolo UNICO ripreso dopo molti anni per riassaporare le meccaniche e la bellissima ambientazione. Ho comprato la copia digitale perchè la vecchia originale aveva qualche problema di compatibilità. Personalmente l'ho sempre considerato un ottimo titolo e ancora oggi dopo averci impiegato 170 ore per rigiocare ogni singola mappa/avventura e colonia ne rimango affascinato tanto da sperare prima o poi in un reboot con qualche bilanciamento nei Templi o qualche miglioramento Grafico. Devo ancora prendere in mano l'espansione "Poseidon" che ho giocato molto meno in passato, che ricordo per l'aggiunta di qualche contenuto che in realtà NON mi è piaciuto se non per la mappa globale. Ho anche aperto l'editor 2-3 volte, e probabilmente con 10 anni di meno mi sarei anche azzardato a creare qualche contenuto nuovo, mi sono accontentato di provare e importare qualche mappa fatta fanmade da altre persone.
Il gioco è abbastanza semplice, capite le dinamiche e come portare a termine i vari requisiti di avventura, poi ci si perde a riempire la mappa e saturare quanto più possibile.
A volte serve semplicemente tempo, altre ci si complica la vita per niente, ma anche quello è il bello del gioco. Non sempre si risolve tutto al primo tentativo, e a volte si scoprono anche strade alternative. Ogni avventura ha qualcosa di particolare, limitazioni edifici o di risorse, scarsi soldi o commercio, limitata grandezza di mappa, divinità contrariate, invasioni nemiche e rivali da tenere a bada fino ad arrivare alle calamità e disastri e all'evocazione degli Eroi per i Mostri.
Pecca del gioco senza girarci attorno è la gestione dell'esercito che non è fluida come giochi similari e in alcune occasioni tende a mostrare pure dei Bug a livello di gestione. Esistono delle percentuali ma lasciando intendere il minimo indispensabile, quando attacchi o difendi potrebbe risolversi in maniera completamente non calcolata. Modificata leggermente la gestione delle Truppe basterebbe poi aggiungere qualche miglioria ai templi minori e non servirebbe fare altro, se non aggiungere grafiche, mappe e avventure nuove. Ci si ritrova spesso a costruire gli stessi templi anche a causa dei requisiti degli Eroi. Qualche aggiunta situazionale a determinate loro funzioni non guasterebbe. Un diverso utilizzo del kraken per Poseidone come supporto d'attacco (simile a trireme) oppure per Dioniso la possibilità di razziare risorse senza abbassare il grado di stima o che consente il cambio di diplomazia verso centauri e amazzoni. Un Afrodite che trasforma gli alleati in vassalli che portano doni ogni anno. Un Ermes che se pregato si recupera una risorsa specifica. 
Tuttu questo perchè nel corso di tutte le avventure capiterà anche di non aver mai edificato alcuni templi se non per semplice curiosità perchè mai richiesti, per saturazione massima (4 max) o mai veramente così indispensabili.

Per il resto nulla da aggiungere perchè intrattiene bene e si scosta dai classici giochi in cui gestisci solo eserciti e ti sprona invece a costruire curare la gestione economica, in questo campo forse il migliore che ho mai provato.
Qualche avventura (Enea/Titani/Troia vista da Ettore/Ercole Dio) o mappa nuova con qualche mito rifatto, qualche bilanciamento e una nuova grafica sicuramente gli renderebbe ancora la giusta gloria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155805296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1711688664}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992880692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1627336483}
review:
Zeus is another one, in the long line of city building games by Impression. All the city building games (Caesar, Pharaoh, Zeus, and Emperor) play similarly, and if you like one, you will probably like them all, with the understanding that earlier titles get more obtuse, and difficult, and less polished. 

In these city building games you are given scenarios with a specific goal in mind, then build your city a little bit like a puzzle, working with the restrictions of the map to fulfill that goal. With Zeus being one of the later titles it is more polished, having many features that were sorely lacking from previous titles (like roadblocks!). You feel like you are given all the tools to make a efficient, well thought out city every time. These games are not about building a huge metropolis that grows organically over time. No, you are given a goal, build your city and economy to achieve that goal, when done, move on. It is not terribly fun to just build a sandbox in this game, but I personally like the structure and challenge of the scenarios, so to me it is not a bad thing.

As mentioned, Zeus improves the gameplay from the previous titles but doesn't really change it much. Zeus is much funnier however, and does have a very different feel than the previous games. The firewatch man's cape is burning as he looks around the city for fires. The college is clearly a hard drinking fraternity. The traders play dice during their downtime. Gags and jokes are everywhere. Also, while the previous titles were rooted in reality and history, here the gods walk about your city, heroes fight monsters, and all that other mythological greek stuff is reality in Zeus. 

While I have not played emperor (I didn't play it as a kid, and it is currently not available on steam) I have played the others. From all the ones available here on Steam, Zeus is the one I recommend people start with. It makes the most sense, and has the fewest hidden mechanics. It is accessible, and while still a bit hard to get into, it is very doable in an afternoon. 

I can recommend this game for anyone wanting to revisit the old city building series or any puzzle buff looking for something to get into who doesn't mind playing an older game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067159306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1558242106}
review:
One of the best games that I ever played since 20 years ago.
Countless hours of fun has been invested in this game, truly masterpiece!
Got me hooked into Greek Mythology.

When I saw this in Steam, I just bought it in a heartbeat, didn't care about the price.
Thank you for filling my childhood memories.

Wish there will be more games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561199185099260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1628788996}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079322277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1628707783}
review: Эта игра занимает особенно нежное место в моем сердце с детства. Прекрасный геймлей, чудесная озвучка, много юмора и обожаемые мною греческие мифы - у меня не было ни единого шанса не влюбиться. Не смотря на старость игра все еще выглядит весьма симпатично, не говоря уже о прекрасном звуковом сопровождении. Если у вас все еще сводит олдскулы например от тех же Age of Empires, а детство прошло в окружении с трудом добытых писаных-перезаписаных дисков - игра явно для вас.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120721869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1625430373}
review: I was really looking forward to playing this game that I remember so fondly.  Alas, I've been is by the "Error: Cannot Save Game" problem and I've tried all the fixes I can find and nothing works.  Now I'm stuck with a game I can't play, and no refund from Steam because I bought it more than two weeks ago.  Activision doesn't care either, since the game is so old.  Oh well.  I  definitely won't be spending money on any retro games form now on though!
