author: {'steamid': '76561198044919732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 3951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3951, 'last_played': 1625425281}
review:
[h1][u][b]Intro[/b][/u][/h1]
[b][i]Zeus + Poseidon[/i][/b] è un city builder sviluppato da [i]Impressions Games[/i] e pubblicato da [i]Sierra Entertainment[/i] nel 2000.
Parenti del celebre franchise [i]Caesar[/i] (condividono il distributore) questi due titoli manterranno per sempre un posto d’onore nel Pantheon dei strategici del nuovo millennio. Semplicità ed immediatezza trascinano, in un perfetto equilibrio, bellezza grafica, difficoltà di gioco, cura del dettaglio e narrazione. Un titolo [i]classico[/i] che trova tesoro nell’Era classica: ambientato nell’antica Grecia, Zeus e Poseidon sono due lati della stessa medaglia, una [i]medaglia olimpica[/i] che dai tempi andati ancora riesce a stupire.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2537220409

[h1][u][b]Analisi[/b][/u][/h1]
[h2]Storia[/h2]
[b]Narrativa[/b] 
Dalla guerra di Troia ed i viaggi di Ulisse agli albori di Atlantide e la sua catastrofica fine, Zeus e Poseidon ripercorrono la mitologia greca tra comicità e licenze poetico-storiche. Il titolo è volutamente sopra le righe e per nulla serioso. Le trame si presentano qui in avventure: medio-lunghe campagne che ripercorrono gli eventi storici e mitologici principali di ogni città, colonia e polis del Peloponneso. Formate da molteplici episodi, il giocatore dovrà raggiungere obiettivi unici e sequenziali di trama per proseguire e quindi vedere la conclusione di ogni racconto.

[h2]Gameplay[/h2]
[b]Come funziona e cosa va alla grande[/b] 
Il giocatore vede la mappa dall’alto da uno dei quattro punti cardinali e con l’utilizzo del mouse può cliccare su un menù laterale e selezionare l’oggetto o l’edificio da piazzare sul terreno. La mappa è una enorme scacchiera ed ogni edificio occupa uno o più spazi senza sovrapposizioni. Il giocatore deve quindi costruire tenendo conto di cosa è utile e necessario, il posizionamento e la relazione con altri edifici con funzionalità complementari (come fattorie, granari e venditori di cibo). Un sistema che va studiato a dovere, costruire a caso e senza logica porterà dopo pochi minuti al gameover.

Può sembrare uno scherzo ma la più importante feature sono i [i]blocchi stradali[/i]. Questi utilissimi strumenti possono essere posizionati su ogni tipo di strada e la loro funzione è di limitare i movimenti di alcuni NPC. Prendiamo il mercante di cibo, lana ed olio (i tre materiali più importanti per lo sviluppo di ogni quartiere residenziale): se l’agorà è posizionata su una strada senza blocchi, quest’ultimo camminerà all’infinito, terminando le sue risorse e così non raggiungendo chi necessita dei sui beni. Posizionare un blocco stradale permette interessanti evoluzioni planimetriche nello sviluppo della città. Circoscrivere i movimenti dei personaggi funzionali al benessere permette quindi di creare “quartieri” interni alla polis stessa. 

Il gameplay è semplice ed immediato, è difficile esprimere la soddisfazione provata nel vedere i conti in positivo, i carri pieni di merci attraversare le città e magazzini/granai riempirsi e svuotarsi ciclicamente di risorse. Nota negativa è la mancata profondità sul comparto gestionale. Ogni mappa è come un enigma da risolvere, il giocatore deve capire come raggiungere l’obiettivo con le scarse risorse disponibili e nel miglior modo possibile. Questo comporta che ogni missione è limitante e lineare nel suo sviluppo. Il commercio è ristretto sul numero di beni scambiabili tra polis, l’economia è quindi fortemente influenzata da meccanismi interni. Sperimentare è difficile se non impossibile. 

Per concludere, riempire la mappa con centinaia di edifici e vedere l’economia della polis raggiungere ottimi risultati non è semplice. Il giocatore deve continuamente destreggiarsi tra incendi, terremoti, epidemie, il Pantheon del Monte Olimpo o le altre città rivali. Diventare troppo ricchi e forti (o deboli ed indifesi) può generare invidia (gola) tra i vicini. Ottenere il favore di una divinità può generare la rivalità di altre due. Un Dio arrabbiato vi metterà i bastoni tra le ruote in molteplici modi. Essere invasi è comune, questo può avvenire in tre modalità: una Polis rivale manda il suo esercito a conquistarvi (facendo partire una rudimentale RTS mode che può essere impostata in automatico), una divinità appare tra le strade mettendo a soqquadro un quartiere, un mostro prende posizione in un’area economicamente strategica alla tua città. Per rispondere ad un Dio occorre un altro Dio, più potente e quindi superiore. Il giocatore avrà quindi bisogno di costruire un tempio dedicato ad esso per evocarlo. Per sconfiggere un mostro invece basterà costruire la sala dell’Eroe, sua nemesi. Quest’ultimo, dopo aver raggiunto determinati obiettivi per richiamare la sua presenza, visiterà la città ed ucciderà la creatura. Eroi, Dei ed eserciti poi non hanno funzionalità esclusiva di difesa. Comune è utilizzarli per saccheggiare o conquistare polis rivali, rendendole così vassalle per esigere tributi annuali e forzare l’apertura al commercio.

[b]Difficoltà[/b]
Non elevata ma con una costante e crescente sfida. Alcune campagne sono più ostiche di altre e necessitano una elevata dose di pazienza. L’IA degli NPC è semplice e spesso fallace. Necessita continuamente interpretazione ed adattabilità. Purtroppo, l’apparire di mostri, divinità o eserciti nemici in mappe con spazi e risorse limitate è estremamente frustrante (nel caso lo spawn sia nel bel mezzo della città è spesso necessario un riavvio del livello). 

[b]Durata e rigiocabilità[/b]
Per completare tutte le campagne di Zeus + Poseidon ho impiegato circa 65 ore ma ammetto che gioco a questo titolo da vent’anni. Conosco le mappe a memoria, mi muovo meccanicamente ed organizzo le mie città in base alle necessità presenti e future. Moltiplicate le ore per due se è la vostra prima esperienza. Ammetto che ha una elevata rigiocabilità ma che può risultare altamente ripetitivo dopo qualche ora. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2537217974

[h2]Grafica[/h2]
Graficamente le mappe sono enormi scacchiere in 2D su cui si muovono modelli 2.5D di personaggi. Sul lato destro il pannello dei menu permette al giocatore di navigare con facilità sul territorio e fare micromanaging di risorse. Cliccando su nord,sud, ovest, est cambierà anche la prospettiva del mondo di gioco. 

Il mondo isometrico è estremamente colorato e ricco di dettagli, altamente godibile alla vista nonostante la piattezza e staticità. Ogni singolo edificio è ricco di particolari e piccole accortezze animate che danno estrema dinamicità al mondo di gioco. Le strade sono piene di NPC che consegnano merci, le abitazioni si evolvono e cambiano in base ai servizi disponibili nei paraggi, atleti, filosofi ed attori attraversano interi quartieri per raggiungere città vicine e partecipare alle Olimpiadi o altri giochi. Le mappe di Zeus + Poseidon trasmettono vitalità e dinamismo.

[h2]Audio[/h2]
Il doppiaggio presente in questa versione è esclusivamente in lingua inglese, è possibile scaricare anche quello italiano con una mod (è ottimo). Il titolo ha una ripetizione ossessiva di voiceline divertenti da ascoltare, ogni personaggio è cliccabile e dice la sua sulla città e su quello che sta accadendo intorno a lui. La libreria audio purtroppo invece manca di profondità ed i suoni sono estremamente ripetitivi. La soundtrack contiene belle tracce, un misto tra strumentale e suoni ambientali, onirica ed in certi casi epica.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2537215582
[h1][b]Conclusione[/b][/h1]
[quote][b][i]Zeus + Poseidon[/i] è un manageriale che diverte nella sua immediatezza e leggerezza. Un titolo che, nel suo ciclico ripetersi di attività, intrattiene e possiede l’innata qualità di far perdere la cognizione del tempo. Un classico tra i city builder, apprezzato dai fan ed apprezzabile da chi non si è mai avvicinato al genere.[/b][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198036660443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1297, 'last_played': 1646951749}
review:
[b]BUILD ME A PYRE TO ROAST MY FRIEND UPON[/b]

This game comes from the great Win98 and XP era of city building games a la Age of Empires. This game takes itself less seriously, is more cartoonish, and honestly a lot more fun than AOE sometimes if you want more building and less combat. 

I remember playing the demo in middle school and then doing a school project at a friend's house that owned it. He gave me the CD-ROM to keep and I got a lot of hours of play out of it. Since then, I would sometimes play it in an XP virtual machine until I got it here on Steam. It holds up well and is still fun more than 20 years later. I appreciate that it's available on Steam and includes the expansion pack for a reasonable price. $10 is a good deal. The current summer sale price of $5 is a steal. 

Would recommend if you like the genre. Be sure to build a shrine to Artemis or Ares if given the opportunity.

author: {'steamid': '76561199013244173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1684235735}
review:
Вроде все просто: строим и развиваем древнегреческий город. Как в Ceaser или Pharaon.
Но теперь у нас есть боги, монсты, герои и олимпийские игры (которые регулярно будут к Вам в город приходить, как в хлам пьяный бог вина Дионис)
Мультяшная графика и чувство юмора хорошо затяягивает в эту градостроилку.
Отдельно про то, что для этого жанра редкость - сюжет. Он есть и очень хорошо написан. За основу взяты те самые мифы Древней Греции про Геракла, Персея, Тесея, Одисея и прочие. А в аддоне еще играем за Атдантиду)))
Однозначно стоит попробовать - затягивает на долго)))

author: {'steamid': '76561198058735584', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7838, 'last_played': 1703225749}
review:
This game is like Ajax- head and shoulders above the rest!

Like many people here, I was so glad to see this classic masterpiece on Steam!

The music is great, the art style is fantastic, and the voice acting is the best part of this game.

Many city-builder fans say Pharaoh or Caesar 3 is the superior game, and yeah, Zeus is definitely the easiest Impressions city builder game. Not too complex to manage a city when compared to Caesar 3, Pharaoh(market and labor is kinda wonky imo) and even Emperor(Fengshui, and the need to supply multiple foods to make people happy). However, I think that's part of the charm of the game. This is a great fun game to introduce people to the city building genre.

The Atlantis expansion(Poseidon) makes the game even more entertaining and provides more playtime with the additional campaign- honestly though, I prefer the original Zeus art style over the Poseidon one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219223383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1621948684}
review:
Quel PLAISIR de retrouver ce jeu ! Dans ma jeunesse, j'avais passé des heures incalculable sur toute la série : Ceasar, Pharaon, Zeus ou encore Empereur que je rêve DÉSESPÉRÉMENT de voir un jour arriver sur Steam et le plus tôt, sera le mieux ;)

Seul bémol à cette évaluation jusqu'ici enchanteresse, c'est le non support de la langue FR ! Alors là, excusez moi du peu, mais c'est tout simplement une honte. Surtout quand on sait (si on était possesseur des versions d'origines comme moi, que le FR était natifs avec les CDs quand on achetait le jeu.

Alors bien sûr, on va me dire : "Pourquoi tu gueules, les patchs sont dispos sur internet, t'as qu'à le faire toi même". Hé bien c'est justement ça le problème. C'est que, pour le prix de vente du jeu, qui, 20 ans après reste quand même assez élevé hein, il faut le dire, ce soit NOUS qui soyons obligé de tous les patcher si on souhaite les avoir en FR... Là dessus, il y aurait quand même pu avoir un effort de fait.

Déjà que de vendre chaque jeu à 10 €, hors promo, c'est exorbitant... (pour info, il y a 20 ans, j'ai payé la version boite de Pharaon + Cléopâtre 10 € alors, payer le même prix 20 ans plus tard pour la version digitale, j'trouve ça légèrement abusé, d'autant plus que le FR n'est pas donné avec la copie ... ET QU'IL EXISTE ! c'est ça le plus aberrant) ... m'enfin bon ...

Il fonctionne nickel, on retrouve les sensations d'antan, c'est l'essentiel. Un VRAI retour aux city builders du début des années 2000 qu'on aime tant ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198013477515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 74, 'playtime_at_review': 2167, 'last_played': 1711297605}
review:
Das warscheinlich beste Aufbauspiel aller Zeiten.
Ich liebe es und spiele die Kampagnen mindestens einmal im Jahr alle durch.

Das ist das einzige Aufbauspiel, dass ich immer wieder hervorkrame und das bestimmt schon seit 15 Jahren.

Es ist komplex - aber nicht zu komplex
Es ist nicht überfrachtet - trotzdem entdecke ich bei jedem Durchlauf etwas neues. 
Es ist wunderbar gealtert und wird wahrscheinlich noch in 50 Jahren spielbar sein. 

Ich liebe dieses Spiel.

Ich empfehle jedem der Handel/Wisim/Aufbauspiele mag dieses Spiel unbedingt auszuprobieren. 
Wenn du dazu noch Mythologie gut findest dann MUSST du dieses Spiel haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006782304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2062, 'last_played': 1709495707}
review: Srdeční záležitost, krásná a nestárnoucí. Kéž by v dnešní době vyšlo něco stejného s novou grafikou a dalším propracováním. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198447967193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1618328551}
review: 本来只是想补个票，但在玩了几款向它致敬的作品又都不怎么好玩。突然间灵光一闪，既然致敬作品不好玩，那我为什么不直接玩原版呢？于是十多年前的旧日时光，它们都回来了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198440948360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1628607879}
review: Kaum zu glauben, dass ein 20 Jahre altes Spiel so viel Spaß macht. Die Grafik ist zwar etwas veraltet, aber das Gameplay ist entscheidend. Bei " free-to-play" aus dem Genre geht man entweder pleite oder arbeitet stundenlang und stresst sich. Hier kann relativ entspannt spielen. Die Tutorials würde ich allerdings jedem ans Herz legen, sonst sind die ersten Level verwirrend. Es ist schön eine Aufbausimulation spielen zu können ohne alle 10 Minuten zur Kasse gebeten zu werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561199152487941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3724, 'last_played': 1691700654}
review:
ZEUS: I absolutely loved this game when it first came out...so imagine my joy when I realised I could play it again  on here. The graphics do seem dated compared to the latest games of today, but the reassuring familiarity just adds to the pleasure. 
I forgot how annoying the pop ups can be "collapsed building" "plague" "no food"  but that's just part of the game, and the fact that I'm as rubbish at it now as I was then lol..and to be fair you get use to them after a while.
The game plays well for an older style game, with no glitches that I've seen so far. It is a slow paced mythological simulation game, with different quests rating from easy to hard.
POSEIDON: Is similar to Zeus in style, with just a few changes. This is the first time I've ever played it, but found it as good as Zeus as it had the same layout and similar feel about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084923553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2506, 'last_played': 1616620248}
review:
Si has jugado al Faraón (Pharaoh) y su expansión Cleopatra, este es muy similar, aunque a mí se me hace más fácil. Hay que tener muchísimas menos cosas en cuenta (a veces se agradece), pero también es cierto que es más limitado, aunque bien pueda ser por las aventuras que he elegido.

Definición: Es un juego de construir ciudades en las cuales van surgiendo eventos a los que tienes que hacer frente (suelen ser parte de los objetivos). 

Ahora, PROS y CONTRAS siempre desde mi punto de vista de haberle metido ochocientas mil horas al Faraón (antes de que Steam siquiera fuera una idea) y mis "pocas" horas a este juego.

PROS:
* Es intuitivo.
* Más sencillo que el Faraón, con muchísimas menos cosas a tener en cuenta (como que los ciudadanos no tienen por qué vivir cerca de un edificio de producción para que haya trabajadores así que por fin se pueden usar los controles de carretera con sentido; no hay un edificio para bomberos y otro para arquitectos sino que son los dos lo mismo...)
* Con poco desarrollo en cuanto a terreno utilizado, se pueden alcanzar los objetivos.
* Es un descanso que alcanzar el nivel superior de una casa corriente y moliente requiere muchíííísimo menos que en el Faraón.
* Los dioses son majetes, no hay que estar pendiente de hacerles festivales.
* La logística de básicamente todo es más sencilla por lo anteriormente comentado.
* No hay Nilo; no importan las crecidas, no hay que aprovechar cada milímetro de tierra y hacer un tetris, no hay que rezar a los cielos para que al trabajador le dé tiempo a recolectar y salir antes de que se lo trague las aguas...
* Aún no me he encontrado con problemas para el agua... Puedes poner una fuente en cualquier sitio. Ergo puedes edificar en cualquier sitio.
* No hay pasos de aguas. Un puente vale para TODO.
* Las voces molan, los textos están hechos de forma cómica y te da gusto leerlos.

CONTRAS:
* Es mucho más sencillo. Esto depende totalmente de lo que te guste y el nivel de dificultad que quieras.
* Hay eventos que pueden fastidiarte la partida entera si no has tenido un cuidado extremo (y/o mucha suerte).
* Mercadear es fácil hasta cierto punto porque por cada lugar con el que quieras comerciar hay que edificar un sitio concreto. Esto me lleva al siguiente punto...
* Para la costa sólo se puede edificar en lugares muy concretos, así que tienes que decidir qué necesitas.
* No puedes bloquear la producción de un producto en concreto (como se puede en el Faraón), sino que sólo puedes eliminar el edificio. Esto suele suceder sobre todo en los edificios militares, cuando quizá no necesites que haya nadie trabajando en un trirreme. O quizá tengas sobreproducción de algo y quieras paralizar la producción durante un tiempo determinado... Bien, pues no se puede; tienes que eliminar el edificio o jugar con las prioridades, pero en tal caso, estarías englobando TODOS los edificios de producción de cada sección (i.e. todos los edificios militares). 
* WASD POR FAVOR.

NEUTRO:
* No está más que en inglés. A mí me da igual, pero entiendo que hay conceptos difíciles si no se maneja bien el idioma.

De momento es todo lo que puedo decir. ¿Lo recomiendo? Sí, encarecidamente. ¿Más que el Faraón? Quizá como paso previo al Faraón o si éste te ha parecido demasiado difícil y quieres ganar con mayor facilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043218840', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 20466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15010, 'last_played': 1707178905}
review:
I got this game in 2001 and played it constantly.  Eventually computers got so advanced that I couldn't get the disc to work without a lot of effort.

Then a few years ago I saw it on Steam.

20 years later and this game is still just as good as it was when I was young. If you like city builders, you're doing yourself a disservice by not playing this game. 

The art is wonderful, the music is wonderful, the voice acting is shockingly good for its time. Every time I've played a city builder I end up comparing it to this one.

Buy it, play it, love it. Thank me later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198866735736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 233, 'playtime_at_review': 1559, 'last_played': 1711626593}
review: My very first encounter of this game was back in year 2007. I was in grade school and my uncle who's in college is playing it. I was greatly intrigued and played it a lot. Years later, PC gaming in both grade school and high school was banned by my parents, so long story short - after completing college, I now had my own laptop and now I downloaded Steam, I thought to myself, "maybe there is ZEUS here!". I was really really hopeful. And now, I'm so glad! so I bought it and I became united with this game after 14 years. Still as difficult as ever but I like it the same!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972583107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1622681944}
review: An oldie but a goodie, at least if you love city building. One of my favourite parts of the Impressions City Building series was how much building you got to do *without* having to constantly be building up defensive forces, a problem many other city builders of its time had. While there's always some combat, it's not the focus of the game, and there are often player decisions you can make that influence how much or how little combat you'll have to face.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311129975', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 270, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1613937661}
review:
This is a tough choice.
The game is surely easier than Pharaoh, because there are lots of "improvements" that removed variety and difficulty.
But some may actually like that they simplied the difficult mechanics, like worker accessibility.
Overall, if you liked the variety of Pharaoh, you'll probably won't like Zeus. Otherwise, if you are looking for a largely more causal version - try it.

review: I used too play this game as kid, still one of the better city builders, think tropico but more diplomacy (war, invasions, trade, vassals and such) the cities normally work pretty well even better then some newer games like tropico (resources can actualy navigate your city) which i also enjoy. great city builder and the graphics actually hold up pretty well being more artful then  the cartoon graphics of say northgard (also great civ game) all in all a great buy.

review:
LE jeu de mon enfance dont je peux aujourd'hui profiter via Steam ! Le jeu n'a pas pris une ride, c'est toujours un vrai régal. 
Le plaisir de construire sa ville et de la faire fructifier, tout en affrontant les difficultés, comme les épidémies, les guerres et j'en passe. Toute ressemblance avec notre réalité ne saurait être que fortuite... hahaha ! (ou pas ?) ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198414511824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1610399339}
review:
Un vrai plaisir de retrouver Zeus, le maître de l'Olympe!
On trouve facilement un mod pour l'avoir en français et mettre les graphismes en HD. De l'ultra classique de gestion de ville... mais la nostalgie de mes années de lycées où je construisait une citée grecque plutôt que de révisé mon bac!

author: {'steamid': '76561198210798932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1612900658}
review:
Ce jeu est l'un des plus mémorable de Sierra ! (kuste après Pharaon ! (Pharaon qui va avoir un remake : pharaoh a new area, sur Steam en 2021!)) Le voir sur steam m'a agréablement surprise. Je l'ai donc prit n'ayant plus la version physique.

Le jeu est en  anglais, mais un patch français éxiste, voici  le lien : https://traductionjeux.com/Zeus-Gold-patch-fr.html
Dans le fichier zip, lancez le patcher et désignez le  dossier d'installation de Zeus.

Il tourne parfaitement sur windows 10. La nostalgie est au rendez vous !

review: I have loved these games since I was a child and had no real idea what I was doing! Being able to play them again all these years later, without the concern of the original discs (which I do still have) not working anymore. I have not encountered a city builder the the caliber of this line and the other line by Impression Games, Pharaoh and Cleopatra. I *HIGHLY* recommend this games and sequel combo to anyone the even remotely enjoys city building games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054714551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4149, 'last_played': 1700543807}
review: Even after all these years, this is one of the most entertaining and vastly replayable city simulators I've ever played. The cartoonish graphics don't suffer much from the passage of time, the sense of humor is entertaining, game mechanics are solid, and it's just plain fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198947637535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1609545258}
review: A classic I played during childhood, and it brought back good memories. I do recommend it to anyone that likes Greek mythology and open sandbox.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027281983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1597599261}
review: Me encanta este juego, recuerdo recibirlo con una revista de juegos pasado el año 2000. Como buen fan de títulos de época como el caesar, age o simcity. este juego cuenta con la particularidad de disponer de grandes campañas divididas en varios actos y en distintos puntos siguiendo un hecho histórico o mitológico (mas o menos). No es un gran reto pues la dificultad se vuelve insana al subirla y excesivamente fácil en normal. Usa el mismo motor y metodología que el pharaon, del cual arregla algunas cosas pero sigue con el problema eterno de la búsqueda de personal y la necesidad de almacenamientos sectorizados. Es un buen juego, los hay mejores ahora pero sigue siendo disfrutable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033212328', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2941, 'last_played': 1610041686}
review:
Despite being one of the easiest Impressions Games' city builders i always enjoyed it significantly more than some of their other entries.

The graphics have aged very well. The sprites are colorful and pleasant, the animations are clean.
The sound design is really good, the music might not stand out on it's own but it makes for a good background during the HOURS you'll spend appreciating your city. The voice acting is absolutely incredible and helps a lot to immerse yourself into the game as every citizen tells you few words from themselves when u click on them.
The story.. well it's history. Mythology to be more specific. If you're interested in greek mythology you'll surely enjoy the little chapter-cut stories this game tells as u try and flourish your cities alongside some legendary Heroes, Monsters and Gods.

In conclusion, It's one of the games i always love to come back to and now that i have it on Steam I always have easy access to it which was an issue before.

Since it's so cheap i highly recommend giving it a try!

review: This classic city builder is in the same (originally "Sierra") city builder series that included Caesar (I, II, III,...), Pharaoh and Cleopatra, and one that centered on the Chinese culture as well. This one, unlike the others, was more 'toon'-like and had humor liberally interspersed in the game play. I have to say that after all these years, this one has remained my favorite and I go back to it again and again. I still have the original game disks but play it on Steam now for ease of use, and lack of the DVD player!

author: {'steamid': '76561198177079539', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1567446567}
review:
I had been waiting for this to be re-released for quite some time. This gem of a city-builder game is amazing. It takes me back to the years, I would play this for hours and hours on my Windows XP desktop. 
The game itself is hours of fun, if you enjoy city building, completing quests and appeasing the Greek Gods.
You can play in sandbox, or play through multiple campaigns in different difficulties in both games Zeus and Poseidon. 
I never really focus on the battle aspects of the game, I just bribed them to make them go away. So whether you want to amass an army and rule all of ancient Greece, or just focus on your city. This game will let you do it all while building temples and seeing Gods and Monsters. (This is by far my favorite in the series of games about ancient culture city building by Impression Games)

author: {'steamid': '76561198085979609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1605295080}
review:
Probablemente haya mucho de nostalgia en esta reseña, pero Zeus es un juego genial de hace 20 años que incluso hoy en día sigue siendo una joya.

Zeus es un constructor de ciudades simple y fácil de entender pero con cierta profundidad a la hora de jugarlo. Básicamente debemos desarrollar nuestra ciudad administrando recursos como materia prima, población, comercio, etc. Sumado a esto tenemos un apartado "mitológico", es decir, se pueden adorar diferentes dioses a traves de templos que nos darán distintos beneficios. Pero no se detiene ahi, muchas veces tendremos que cumplir misiones para los dioses e inclusive tendremos que combatir bestias mitológicas que deidades rivales nos meten en el camino.  Y como si eso no fuera poco, nuestra ciudad no esta aislada del resto de Grecia. Numerosas ciudades pueden alzarse en nuestra contra, o pueden buscar formar alianzas. Podemos crear nuestro propio ejercito para defendernos o atacar, o podemos optar por usar los heroes si tenemos su favor.

Muchas horas de juego hay en esta joya. Multiples campañas y numerosos escenarios abiertos, (aparte de la expansión, Poseidón). 

En Windows 10 lo pude correr sin ningún problema, aunque las resoluciones por defecto son de 800x600 y 1024x768. Y lamentablemente sólo se encuentra en inglés. Ambos problemas se pueden resolver facilmente buscando en los foros de Steam. Al momento de la reseña estoy jugandolo a resolución 1920x1080 y con voces y textos en español.

Para amantes de constructores de ciudades es casi obligación jugarlo, para los demás es más que recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561199099848797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2858, 'last_played': 1673544770}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985841446', 'num_games_owned': 1724, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1533493895}
review:
Released in 2000, with its expansion pack coming out the year after, this game was one of the definitive titles of my childhood, along with such classics as Diablo 1, the Crash Bandicoot franchise and CoC: Red Alert. Words cannot describe the nostalgia that I feel toward this title, but I will try not to let that cloud my judgment.

As a fun aside, I had a Swedish edition of this game growing up, with no apparent option (that I could find) to change the language, and being a Danish kid.. Well, I frankly had little clue what was going on. But that never stopped me from enjoying it!

[b]The game:[/b] This game is a city building and management game with some adventure-RTS elements thrown in for good measure. It has both campaign and free-play options that allow you to experience however you want. The expansion een added it the ability to create your own scenarios, for the creative ones out there. The city building and management genre was something that Impression Games really seemed to have nailed down, and it shows in this one, that confidently offers and experience that's both ahead of its time and comfortably intermediate in terms of difficulty and complexity, all set against a convincing backdrop based on Greek mythology and tradition. 

[b]Graphics:[/b] Graphically, I find that this game actually holds up remarkably well. It's certainly more pleasing on the eyes than the myriad of primitive, voxel-based aesthetics of many a modern indie title in the same price range. The sprites are pleasant to look at it and the maps are comfortably muted. The animations might come across as staggering and a little lacking, similar to what you'd find in a game like Diablo 2, but then again, it is a 20 year old game. 

All in all, I heartily recommend fans of city builders, Greek mythology and late 90's/early 00's classics to check out this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966876889', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1338, 'last_played': 1690909972}
review:
Délicat, quand on pas eu le plaisir de grandir avec ce jeu, de lui trouver du charme. 
En effet, on est face à un jeu lent, pas forcément toujours beau, qui demande souvent un travail de micro-gestion un poil repoussant et un investissement de longue durée pour espérer créer une ville qui tienne la route. 

Mais pour celles et ceux qui retrouvent ce jeu, au hasard de Steam, quel plaisir, quel nostalgie. Cette bande son reposante, cette mythologie fascinante, ces petites remarques de vos habitants, c'est petits bruits d'ambiance, ce temps qui passe doucement et agréablement. J'aime profondément ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054261528', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 12898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10491, 'last_played': 1705610349}
review:
Ich denke ich muss nicht viel zu dem Spiel sagen, wer das hier liest wird das Spiel oder andere Ableger wie z.B Caesar 3 oder Pharao kennen. Trotzdem möchte ich mit meiner Positiven Review zusätzlich auf dieses Spiel aufmerksam machen, den es ist mir ehrlich gesagt ein Rätsel wieso so viele Leute z.B den Pharao Ableger bevorzugen, zudem für mich unverständlicher weise ein Remake in Produktion ist.

Zeus ist spürbar neuer und durchdachter, sämtliche Spiel features wurden optimiert und verfeinert und auch das Gameplay und die Atmosphäre werden durch die Götter, Ungeheuer und Helden (die es so nur in diesen Teil gibt) deutlich verstärkt wodurch das Spiel wesentlich mehr Tiefe besitzt.

Vergleicht einfach mal Gameplay auf Youtube, gibt zu allen Teilen gute Videos dann werdet ihr verstehen was ich meine.

Es gibt nur zwei Dinge zu beachten....1. Ist das Spiel hier nur auf Englisch! (steht auf der Shop Seite auch dran als hört auf zu meckern nachdem ihr es gekauft habt) und 2. sind die Götter Animationen auf neueren Betriebssystemen verbugt. 
Ich konnte jedoch beides mit Hilfe von "Community Patches" fixen..das ist jetzt allerdings schon etwas her, ka wies da heute mit den verfügbaren Downloads aussieht. Also vllt lieber vorher im Internet informieren, ansonsten läuft das Spiel auch auf Win 10, 64 bit etc einwandfrei.

Fazit: Auch heute noch ein perfektes Aufbau-Strategie Spiel bei dem man zusätzlich einiges über die Griechische Mythologie lernen kann, wenn ein Teil der Reihe ein Remake verdient hat dann ganz klar Zeus.

review: I got this forever ago as like a bargain bin gift, and I blame this game for me not being able to focus on schoolwork. Now that I have it on Steam, I can blame my adult-work not being done on it. Such good memories. Sims meets Civ, I can easily spend an entire day/night just tending to my cities. By today's standards, graphics are terrible, but to be honest it doesn't take away from the storyline or gameplay. Build your city, defend against monsters, win.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332606291', 'num_games_owned': 856, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1654349632}
review:
Ein sehr altes, aber für mich immer noch prägendes Aufbauspiel.
Glücklich bin ich natürlich darüber, dass es das Spiel auf Steam gibt - wenn auch nur in Englisch.
Für Leute die natürlich Probleme mit der englischen Sprache haben empfiehlt sich die Installation von Sprachpakete, die über diverse externen Webseiten verfügbar ist.

Allen die dieses Spiel nicht kennen empfehle ich einfach mal es auszuprobieren. 
Und diejenigen, die das Spiel bereits von früher kennen und lieben wünsche ich viel Spaß damit!

author: {'steamid': '76561198365377503', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4429, 'last_played': 1559577231}
review:
Jeu de gestion très sympathique. 
Le jeu en soi n'est pas très compliqué, mais il y a quand même quelques difficultés qui permettent d'avoir un minimum de challenge (les approvisionnements divers, l'apparition des monstres sur certains pans de la carte qui empêche le développement de la ville dans cette région,...). 
Au niveau du thème, on aime ou on n'aime pas le thème antique, mais je le trouve bien exploité : les monstres et héros, le scénario général, font un chouette parcours dans la mythologie grecque. 
En revanche, le jeu est répétitif, et le tour des différents aspects est assez vite fait. Le fait qu'une fois les objectifs atteints, le scénario s'arrête pour passer au prochain épisode peut aussi être frustrant pour les joueurs qui aiment développer une ville et la voir s'agrandir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098069162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1599944378}
review:
Feels like old school Sim City meets original WarCraft, but with the fun twist of Ancient Greece. This game is a world-building challenge game with specific goals/quests/missions to meet (starting from scratch each time, a la WarCraft). As someone who, as a generous description, never excelled at StarCraft vs AI (outside of the storyline), I find this game quite challenging. Sometimes it feels nigh impossible and I want to ragequit but it's never so bad that I don't come crawling back to it, haha. If you're into the aforementioned games, you'll probably enjoy this.

Graphics are what you would expect for a game along the lines of old Sim City, maybe a little nicer. Pretty straightforward in terms of how to play and build if you have any familiarity with these types of games, though I went through the tutorial to figure out the order of building things and what some of the extra features did/what the benefits were. I only wish I were better at it!
